bill_title: Affirming South Dakota's state and federal elected officials to uphold their sworn duty by taking all legal actions available to combat illegal immigration and the trafficking of illegal aliens within our state.

bill_versions.bill_text: A RESOLUTION, Affirming South Dakota's state and federal elected officials to uphold their sworn duty by taking all legal actions available to combat illegal immigration and the trafficking of illegal aliens within our state. WHEREAS, we believe the strength of our nation lies with the individual and with each person's dignity, liberty, and integrity; and WHEREAS, we support our nation's heritage of religious freedom and personal responsibility and recognize we must be proactive in defending freedom at every level; and WHEREAS, we believe in equal rights, equal justice, and equal opportunity for all, regardless of race, creed, sex, age, or ability; and WHEREAS, we support the right of immigrants to enter our country legally and support the right of legal immigrants to work in our state; and WHEREAS, it is the responsibility of the federal and state government to enforce immigration laws and protect our borders; and WHEREAS, there is a tremendous economic cost to the citizens of South Dakota for the number of illegal immigrants and refugees coming to South Dakota; and WHEREAS, we support efforts to require the courts of South Dakota to refrain from relying upon foreign law and judgments contrary to the public policy of South Dakota, the South Dakota Constitution, and the United States Constitution; and WHEREAS, terrorist organizations are growing and becoming more dangerous every year with multiple acts of terrorism; and WHEREAS, the Department of Homeland Security has declared that it is impossible to screen refugees from Syria and other Mideast countries; and WHEREAS, President Obama vowed to bring in at least 10,000 Syrian refugees, while others on the left vowed to bring in at least 500% more; and WHEREAS, many states and governors have implemented policies restricting immigrants that have not been thoroughly vetted; and WHEREAS, sanctuary cities have violated federal law allowing convicted felons to have a safe harbor, threatening the lives of all American citizens; and WHEREAS, the Department of Homeland Security has historically not fully enforced federal laws regarding immigration; and WHEREAS, extremist Islamic terrorism has become a major threat to America's national security: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the Senate of the Ninety-Third Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that we urge South Dakota's state and federal elected officials to uphold their sworn duty by taking all legal actions available to combat illegal immigration and the trafficking of illegal aliens within our state; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Senate encourages the House of Representatives to join our call to help protect the citizens of South Dakota from the threat of terrorism.
